subject: RE: Why doesn't JUnit count asserts?
msgSnippet: ... My version of JUnit doesn t count asserts, but it probably should, so it would provide a warning if a testcase has no assertions in it.
messageBody:
RE: Why doesn't JUnit count asserts?

>As an aside, we count asserts instead of tests because it's a finer grained
>metric.  Right now we only have 8 functional test methods, but 170
>assertions.  When we add to a functional test we don't create a new test
>method, we add some more assertions to an already existing test.  It would
>be harder to see progress if we tracked test cases.

My version of JUnit doesn't count asserts, but it probably should, so it would provide a warning if a testcase has no assertions in it.
